section.p: Metrics and alarm history data is stored in the InfluxDB database. InfluxDB features data retention mechanisms that allow you to define your data retention policies as required by your monitoring environment. By default, automatically deletes metrics and alarm history data from the database if it is older than 60 days.
To change the data retention settings that were defined when installing , you use the InfluxDB command line interface, the interactive shell that is provided for the database. Proceed as follows:

ol.li: Log in to the host where is installed.

Go to the directory where InfluxDB is installed:
cd /usr/bin

Connect to InfluxDB using the InfluxDB command line interface as follows:
./influx -host <host_ip>
Replace <host_ip> with the IP address of the machine on which is installed.
The output of this command is, for example, as follows:
Connected to http://localhost:8086 version 0.9.1 InfluxDB shell 0.9.1

Connect to the InfluxDB database of (mon):
> show databases name: databases ---------------- name mon
> use mon Using database mon

li.p: To update your data retention policy, use the ALTER RETENTION POLICY command:
li.codeblock: ALTER RETENTION POLICY <policy_name> ON <db_name> DURATION <duration> REPLICATION <n> [DEFAULT]
li.p: Replace <policy_name> with the name of the retention policy you define. Multiple policies can be defined, one of them is set as default. persister_all is the name of the policy that is initially installed by .
Replace <db_name> with the name of your database.
Replace <duration> with the time period after which the data is to be deleted. The minimum retention period is one hour. You can use the following options for specifying the time period:
Replace <n> with the number of nodes on which the InfluxDB database is installed. The replication factor is only relevant if is installed in cluster mode.
Use [DEFAULT] to set the new retention policy as the default retention policy for your database.
Example for deleting data if it is older than 30 days:
li.codeblock: ALTER RETENTION POLICY my_policy ON mon DURATION 30d REPLICATION 1 DEFAULT

ol.li:
Restart the influxdb service, for example, as follows:
sudo systemctl restart influxdb

section.p: For an introduction to the InfluxDB command line interface, refer to the InfluxDB CLI/Shell documentation. For details on data retention, refer to Retention Policy Management.
